source_note: State baseline derived from Alabama Department of Environmental Management (ADEM) recycling guidance; municipal programs may vary.

organics.guidance: Composting and yard waste recycling encouraged; not required statewide.
organics.bin: Green bin or compost drop-off site.
organics.notes: Some cities like Huntsville and Birmingham offer yard waste pickup.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars where accepted; rinse before recycling.
glass_containers.notes: Glass not accepted curbside in all areas.

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel/tin cans (clean and empty).

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles and jugs labeled #1â€“#2; other plastics vary locally.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Alabama has no container deposit law.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle via curbside or drop-off program.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries at HHW sites.
household_batteries.notes: Keep out of trash and curbside bins.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste accepted at local collection events or drop-off centers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky waste must be scheduled for pickup or taken to landfill.
bulky_items.notes: Contact local sanitation department for details.
